content.description:
Aeneas quibus in mediis sic deinde locutus:
“Accipite haec animis laetasque advertiteadverto, -ere: to direct toward mentes.”
content.question: In the sentence, how is Accipite haec animis translated?

choices.label: Accept these things with your hearts
Let this thing be accepted into your hearts
You all accepted this thing with your hearts

content.answer: Accept these things with your hearts

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2
